intro: Rotantha robinsiae, commonly known as the Robinsia rotantha, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in well-drained, rocky soils and thrives in temperate to subtropical climates. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The flowers, which bloom in late spring, are yellow with a distinctive purple center, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
